title: Drop'N'Go VR Snowboarding
description: Drop'N'Go VR Snowboarding in Commented Blueprints!
longDescription:
Hey folks,

Drop'N'Go here with a New VR Release!


Do you love winter sports?

Do you love the thrill of racing down a mountain on your snowboard, or carving up the slopes?

This VR Blueprint Kit puts you right in the middle of the action, with first person to give you the ultimate immersive snowboarding experience, the control system is modular in design, as well as the ability to slot in your own inventory system by following the commented sections, users can use Omni-Boards + Motion Controllers or simply control Natively with their Motion Controllers.

Trailer Here

Original Personal Project Demo Video - Showcasing the use of the pre-defined quick slot areas, again, assets not included. However, if you have questions or need assistance, reach out directly via Discord when you request the Documentation.

It's time to let your players get their shred on!

Demo Here showcasing easily expandability following commented sections for your own custom GP features.


Extended Documentation is given after verification, please post in the review section and reach out on Discord. However, the asset is also heavily commented within the blueprints as well!
technicalDetails:
Features: (Please include a full, comprehensive list of the features of the product)

  • Enum - 1
  • Maps - 1 
  • Material - 1

Number of Blueprints: 3

Input: (If any, please include which methods of input are preconfigured (Gamepad, Keyboard, Mouse... etc.))

Network Replicated: No

Supported Development Platforms:

Windows: Yes

Important/Additional Notes:

Requires OpenXR and/or Oculus VR Plugins


**** When you first enter the project and press play, it will immediately start the snowboarding logic as you go down the mountain side, when you reach the bottom, it may appear as if you are stuck in place or spinning, but that’s because you’ve run out of proper surface room to glide down, I’d suggest creating a new map with a longer travel point, the direction is controlled natively by your hands - so place your hands out as if you were snowboarding and using the Right Hand as the front of the Board and Left Hand as the back of the Board turn in the direction of your choosing. ****



Visual Assets seen in the video are not included

Gloves Model

Snowboard Model

Tree Model

Rock Model

Snow Material (Ultra Dynamic Sky - Ultra Dynamic Weather - Dynamic Material)
